intro: Psychotria djamuensis, commonly known as Jamu psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants with medicinal and ornamental value. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is often found growing in shaded, humid environments, typically in the understorey of tropical forests. Due to its potential pharmacological properties, it has attracted interest in both traditional and modern ethnobotanical research.
